intro: Marsdenia gallardoae, commonly known as the Gallo's Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white flowers that are typically followed by distinctive, fleshy fruits. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
